intro: Psychotria blepharophora var. pubens, commonly known as the pubescent psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its hairy, pubescent stems and leaves, which give it its varietal name. Its flowers are small and clustered, often with a distinctive coloration that attracts pollinators. This species is of interest to botanists and ecologists due to its ecological role and potential medicinal properties.
